learning_outcomes.description: understand the general principles of talent identification and development including long term athlete development models
understand the role of a range of sub-disciplines within the high performance support team or program including sports science and specialist coaching
be able to interpret physiological; biomechanical  and psychological test data to assess the strengths and weaknesses of an athlete
develop ‘optimal’ learning environments to support and accelerate athlete development by drawing upon contemporary views of athlete performance
design and implement training programs using contemporary pedagogical frameworks that positively implicate aspects of athletic performance within an elite or developmental training environment

assessments.due_date:
9/03/2026 - 13/03/2026

30/03/2026 - 2/04/2026

Quizzes will open at 9:00 am Monday and must be completed by 5:00 pm Friday in Week’s 3 and 6. Students can complete the quiz anytime during the opening window, but once open will only have with 20-minutes for completion.
assessments.task_description: At the end of Module’s 1 and 2 there will be a 10 question MCQ – all questions originating from lecture and reading material.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Following the completion of Module 1, you will be required to outline the design of an ‘optimal’ athlete development environment in a sport of your choice, drawing upon the tenets of an ecological dynamics approach.

This case report will consist of six main sections, with more details being provided on the task description located on the course Blackboard site.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Following the completion of Module 2, you will be required to overview how a nonlinear pedagogy could be used to support athlete development in sport.

This case report will consist of three main sections, with more details being provided on the task description located on the course Blackboard.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.
